glossary.definition: Complete record of a candidate including personal information, skills, experience, and application history
A candidate's submission for a specific job posting, linked to their profile
Process of identifying and merging candidate records that refer to the same person
Origin of candidate application (e.g., job board, referral, direct application, recruiter sourced)
Automated extraction of candidate information from resume/CV documents

business_rules: Candidate email addresses must be unique per tenant (one profile per email)
Duplicate candidates are detected using email, phone, or name matching algorithms
When duplicates are detected, system suggests merge with most complete profile as primary
Candidate profiles can have multiple applications to different job postings
Resume/CV uploads are versioned - latest version is primary, previous versions are archived
Candidate data can be marked as 'Do Not Contact' with reason and expiration date
Referral tracking requires referrer employee ID and referral date
Candidate search supports full-text search on resume content, skills, and profile fields
GDPR: Candidate data retention is 2 years after last activity unless consent extended
Candidate communication preferences (email, SMS, phone) must be respected
calculations_or_formulas: Time since last activity = current_date - last_application_date
invariants: Candidate email must be valid and unique within tenant
Candidate profile cannot be deleted if they have active applications
Resume file size must not exceed 10MB
Candidate must have at least first name and email to create profile
Merged candidate profiles preserve all application history
edge_cases: Candidate applies with different email addresses - duplicate detection must identify and suggest merge
Resume parsing fails for non-standard formats - fallback to manual entry with notification
Candidate updates profile while application is in progress - changes apply to all applications
Bulk import of 10,000 candidates - requires batch processing, duplicate detection, and error reporting
Candidate requests data deletion (GDPR) while in active interview process - requires workflow pause
Referral reward calculation when referred candidate is hired - needs integration with rewards system
Candidate profile has conflicting information across multiple applications - needs conflict resolution
compliance_requirements: GDPR: Candidate consent must be obtained before storing personal data
GDPR: Right to access - candidates can request export of all their data
GDPR: Right to deletion - candidates can request profile deletion (with retention exceptions)
Data retention: Candidate profiles inactive for 2+ years must be archived or deleted
Resume storage must be encrypted at rest and in transit
Audit log must track all profile access and modifications

inputs: Candidate personal information (name, email, phone, address)
Application details (job posting ID, application date)

user_journeys: Candidate applies via job board - profile created, resume parsed, application linked
Recruiter searches for candidates with specific skills - results ranked by relevance
System detects duplicate candidate profiles - suggests merge to recruiter
Candidate updates profile information - changes reflected across all applications
Candidate requests data export (GDPR) - system generates and delivers complete data package
Recruiter tags candidate for future opportunities - tag persists across applications
acceptance_criteria_suggestions: Given a new candidate application, when email doesn't exist, then new profile is created and application is linked
Given candidate with existing email, when duplicate detected, then merge suggestion is shown with confidence score
Given resume upload, when parsing succeeds, then candidate profile fields are auto-populated with extracted data
Given GDPR deletion request, when candidate has no active applications, then profile is deleted within 30 days
Given candidate search query, when results found, then candidates are ranked by relevance and profile completeness
open_questions: What is the exact duplicate detection algorithm? (fuzzy matching thresholds, field weights?)
How are resume parsing errors handled? (manual review queue, notification to recruiter?)
What is the maximum number of applications a candidate can have simultaneously?
Are there different profile fields required for different job types/levels?
How is candidate data synchronized with external ATS/HRIS systems?
What is the referral reward structure and calculation method?
assumptions: Resume parsing supports common formats (PDF, DOC, DOCX) and extracts key fields
Duplicate detection runs in real-time during profile creation and periodically in background
Candidate search uses full-text indexing on resume content and profile fields
GDPR compliance features are required for EU-based tenants
